lessons.title: 1. Social Engineering Fundamentals
lessons.description: Learn about social engineering attacks and human psychology in security

pages.title: What is Social Engineering?
pages.content: Social engineering is the psychological manipulation of people into performing actions or divulging confidential information. It exploits human psychology rather than technical vulnerabilities.

pages.title: Common Social Engineering Techniques
pages.content: Common techniques include phishing, pretexting, baiting, quid pro quo, and tailgating. Each technique targets different human vulnerabilities and psychological triggers.

pages.title: Human Psychology in Security
pages.content: Understanding human psychology is crucial for both attackers and defenders. People often make security mistakes due to trust, authority, urgency, and social proof principles.

pages.title: Quiz: Social Engineering
pages.question: What is the primary target of social engineering attacks?
pages.explanation: Social engineering primarily targets human psychology rather than technical systems, exploiting human vulnerabilities and psychological triggers.
